channel.title: asu on Embedded Systems Design
channel.description: Recent content in asu on Embedded Systems Design

item.title: Installing Cadence
item.description: Installation System Requirements PC: Windows 10 (64-bit) Professional, Windows Server 2012 and 2012 R2, Windows Server 2016, or greater (Hardware and Software Requirements).

item.title: ASU PCB Fabrication Process
item.description: How are PCBs fabricated at ASU? The following video shows our PCB manufacturing process.

item.title: Changing the Default Via Padstack in Cadence PCB Editor
item.description: Introduction A via is an electrical interconnection that connects one layer of a PCB to another layer of a PCB.

item.title: Drawing Software
item.description: What is drawing software used for? Drawing software is used to create diagrams for inclusion in presentations and reports.

item.title: From where can I source parts?
item.description: Once you know the types of components that you need for your project, the next step is to find sources/vendors from which you can purchase the components (also known as sourcing parts).

item.title: Mechanical CAD Software
item.description: What is CAD software used for? Computer Aided Drafting (CAD) software is used to capture and simulate designs electronically.

item.title: Peralta 103 Resources
item.description: What equipment is available at each of the benches? Function Generator (5 MHz)

item.title: Running a Design for Manufacturing Check in DFM Now
item.description: Introduction Designs created in an ECAD program may be electrically correct on the screen, but are ultimately constrained by the capabilities of your fabrication equipment.

item.title: What is a Gantt Chart?
item.description: A Gantt Chart is a common project management tool that helps teams understand the phases of a project, deadlines, critical paths, and interdependencies between tasks.
